subject: Winter Is Coming....
event: ... to the United Kingdom, courtesy of our friends at Sky Atlantic. It will arrive at April 18 on the dot. One day after the American premiere. So keep your swords sharp, boys and girls, and sign up for Sky Atlantic.

comments.article:
Love that screenshot! *_* (Of course I do, Arya's my favorite character, so...)

... Wonder when it will come to Sweden... ;;
That shot does beg to have a fun name that caption game, doesn't it?

For Brits wanting to know a bit more:

Sky Atlantic is currently being offered free to all Sky subscribers through August, I believe, so a basic Sky subscription will get it for you.

Also, Sky Atlantic is one of the channels available on the Entertainment Pack for Sky Player, their internet-based viewing service, which is Â£15 a month -- don't actually have to get a dish and so on to see the show via broadband, which sounds like a great deal (especially as it seems you can just sign up on a month-to-month basis).

Finally, a lot of people are holding out hope that Virgin Media will be allowed to carry Sky Atlantic, but right now the pictures looks grim as the two broadcasters are at loggerheads over the pricing, with Sky claiming Virgin is underpricing and Virgin claiming Sky is overpricing.

(And for other foreign fans: beginning of May in Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden on Canal+, May 9th in Spain on Canal+)
Hey, thanks for the info :-)
Aww, I thought winter was coming in March!  No matter, I'm still wildly excited!

Same for me and it is unlikely I will be swapping to sky any time soon...
Though that Â£15 a month to see it on the online sky player might be a possibility.
awesome shot - Arya is my favorite!!
the book is done when it is done!!!
Ooops!forget the book,i meant the show is done when it is done!!
Yep, I'm going to subscribe to cable, specifically HBO, in April.
Is it possible to get HBO if you're not from the USA? I am from Germany and IIRC no TV company did get the rights for the show.
Rights will certainly be sold in Germany sooner or later, so I'd hang tight.

Isn't it a little bit spoilerish? The tv series starts in summer, and winter will come only far later... Newcomers will now know about winter, ah ah (only joking here, ser).

I can't wait. I hope Sky will translate and let the tv series come in Italy as (((soon))) a possible!!!! :-)
And where to sign up in tv-poor old germany? :(

I am told Germany (and Italy) are big European markets which have broadcasters that tend to deliberate and take a bit longer to purchase rights than some of the other European countries. However, I think it's probably safe to say that whenever the rights are sold, the air dates will still likely fall well in-line with what you're saying in some other European countries.
I'm so excited! And I just can't hide it! :D (Plus Sky Atlantic is free for all Sky customers ;) Whoop!)

Looks great. I would sign up to Sky Atlantic if I could only sign up to that by itself - but I'm told I would also have to sign up to half a dozen channels I already get on Freeview as well as some other rubbishy ones |I don't want...so I must wait and hope to find another way to get the show...

Oh, didn't know about the Sky online viewer, might actually do that nearer the time!  I'm certainly not getting a dish for a bunch of channels neither I nor my family wishes to watch but I can manage Â£15 for 2-3 months for GOT.  Been waiting for this show for 10 years and I thnk I owe it to that 17 year old who fantasised about Sean Bean as Ned Stark.

I cant get Sky through a dish (I live in a listed building and don't really want it). But have signed up to Sky player and set it up on my Xbox rather than having to watch it on PC.

Guess its too early for any news on DVD / Bluray release.
Couldn't be more excited!
I've just signed up to Sky (something I thought I'd never do) just for this. I can't wait!

I'm really, really glad to see books comes to a TV series - especially BBC production, which I adore. But ... I love to read more than to watch TV. How about that books? I live in a country where books are translated and published 2-5 years after world release, and even then they are expensive to buy them regularly. For all of you, GRRM included, maybe it's been 4 years since the last book, for us it will be 7. For TV series, uhhh ... Maybe never, if I can't find it on internet. Have mercy, start publishing those books!
Oh, and congratulations on your wedding, and to both of you, have a nice and fulfilled life.
comments.subject: books

comments.article: If you are is Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Slovenia, or another Central European country, you may be able to subscribe to HBO Central Europe. All the countries covered by HBO Central Europe will see Game of Thrones the day after it airs in the United States, and the same time as the U.K.
comments.subject: Re: books

comments.article:
So he owns Harpercollins. Damn, I already give him my money, looks like I am already his bitch so getting the online service won't be such a stretch. Game of thrones here I come.
( Will have to find some other way to boycot in the future. )
comments.subject: Mad dog and other Murdock's

comments.article: We all may be Rupert's bitch, but George RR Martin is not our bitch. That's the thing to remember here.
comments.subject: Re: Mad dog and other Murdock's

comments.article: I'll be waiting for the DVDs I'm afraid, subscriptions to sky are not worth it, even for a Game of Thrones, especially when it means subsidising Sky News and Sky Sports.

I can go to a gazillion sites on the internet to see what networks and torrents will be carrying the HBO show but I can only think of one place that I can go to get the news on the next book. That place is here.

Thanks.
comments.subject: Any news on A Dance With Dragons?

comments.article:
A commenter above already answered your query. "It's done when it's done."

Author Neil Gaiman also wrote extensively on this topic. See my reply comment a few comments up.

Re: Any news on A Dance With Dragons?

comments.article: Ah this is awesome news, I really really cannot wait to see the first episode. And all of the rest :)
comments.subject: chtoing chtoing

comments.article:
HÃ¡h!
And they say, Central-Europe is rural. WE will see it on the 18th too! \o/
Hungarian HBO rox!

Just wanna start by saying I'm a big fan. And am greatly looking forward to seeing the TV series adaptation of Ice & Fire.

I was just wondering (if you know or may be able to find out) if the show will be available on the Playstation Network? (If you didn't know its a sort of pay to rent/own TV shows using the Playstation3.) For some of us this may be cheaper than actually having to subscribe to HBO to watch it, but still doing our share and actually paying for it. HBO already uses this for some of their series.

While I've (hopefully) got your attention... What's your take on the 'new' way people are reading (eg: Kindle/Ipad/etc...)?
Personally I think that commercial where the man asks the woman "How can she read in this light?" (while sitting in the sun by the pool) is pretty laughable. Considering they would never ask that if they had bought a book. Not to mention they'll never be able to re-sell that pdf or w/e file type they use on those devices, like they would a real book. It'll never be a collectible like a 1st edition of a printed book is either. Just my two cents.

Anyway, sorry if that ran a little long. And, thanks in advance for your response if you can find the time to. (Bet you could make an entire new post about these 2 simple questions.)

Best regards & please keep up the great work.

xxeroz
comments.subject: Question about availability...

comments.article:
I agree with you that an e-book will never have the same collector value, so let's be glad that books still exist and are still being made. They might become a major niche market (if they havn't already) but books will always be around. I can't wait until the day I can afford to be a collector!

As for your PS3 question, I have heard nothing, but I think it is unlikely. You and others who cannot afford (me) or access (many) the subscription channels that are carrying the show will have to wait until the DVD box set comes out, AND go see it at a friend's if at all possible while it is airing (that is my plan).
comments.subject: Re: Question about availability...

comments.article: I don't think I've seen a single picture of Masie in which the look on her face wasn't priceless.  I already have a feeling that she's going to be a young actress to keep an eye on in the next few years.
Since the show is airing via HBO, will it reflect the violence, gore, and nudity as depicted in the books?
comments.subject: MPAA Rating Equivalent
